caption: The Shaw location has been closed for a long time. I've had trouble ordering from the Bowie location. I think it is difficult for them to run the business from Bowie while they wait for the regular location to, hopefully, open again. They've always had a long wait time for food. An hour is not uncommon. So just know that you will have to work hard and be patient to get this food!  Having said that, no West African restaurant in the DMV comes close to Sumah. Ok, I haven't tried them all, but I've tried a lot. The food at Sumah is worth the trouble. Their stew is the best. Their egusi is the best. Their plantains are the best. They used to make their own ginger beer. Idk if they still do. I used to order it by the gallon!  They are also kind and straightforward. When I first ate at the Shaw location, they gave me a plate with a sample of every stew to try. This place is run like they are passionate about the food, but winging it a bit with the rest of the business. And, honestly, I find it charming. The food is the important part, so 5 stars.

They’re currently delivering only because the restaurant is closed but they are still dedicated to their customers. I ordered one night and they were closing soon so I said I’d call back the next day because I didn’t want to be an inconvenience. But the owner insisted on making my food and drove from Maryland to DC to deliver it (AFTER closing). Truly amazing and genuine people. If you’re looking for mouth watering West African food that can compare to your mom’s cooking this place is for you.
I grew up eating Mr. Sumah's food. A staple of the Shaw community. If you love West African cuisine,  then this is the place for you.

Do not recommended restaurant has been closed over 2 years the owner will meet you to deliver food but not in a timely fashion and get mad at you for not wanting to wait an hour for your food. Very rude and unprofessional

Never been here but I heard how good the food was and I was eager to try it. Nonetheless I called so excited to make my order and the receptionist took my order then says this location is closed but the pick up location is in Bowie MD....wow ok no thanks that's so unprofessional.
Always amazing! Love the texture of the Sumah's West African Restaurant. The garlic noodles are super tasty and not too oily, and I can never get enough coconut rice!
Poor customer service. Ordered food & the delivery was two hours late. Asked for a discount & the owner refused. I will not support this business anymore. Do better.
I’ve been coming here sporadically since I was 16 and Sumah hasn’t failed me once. The food is amazing with just the right amount of flavor and spice. I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT❤️❤️

Sumah's is my favorite West African spot in the entire United States! I LOVE West African food, and this is the best I've EVER HAD! You can't go wrong ordering anything from them. We just had a delicious meal to celebrate my son's 18th birthday during the lockdown here in DC, and he said that he didn't feel so bad about missing out on other stuff because we're eating the best food in the city at home!

This is the best West African Restaurant in DC! The owners are so welcoming and kind! They've been closed for a while and I've been missing out, but I recently called and they delivered my food. It was still as good as I remembered! Quality food & service.

It's been years since I've visited DC but I never forgot where great food exist ,, My partner and I truly enjoyed if it's your first time trying West African food I recommend Casava leaf with your choice of meat

All I can say it  is truly amazing. I did a simple Google search and they popped up. That has been 3 weeks ago and I have been back at lease 6 times. The food is cooked with love and soul the customer service is wonderful. Very friendly service and delicious food Love this place!!!!

This is real authentic African Food! It is very delicious and is served in big quantities. If you are looking for some real good and delicious African food, then Sumah is the place to be. Thank you Sumah for your services!
Love love love Sumas. Can't wait till they open again!!!!

OMG They have been closed for months now but today I was craving cassava leaves so I called hoping for a miracle and I got just that. Sumah answered the phone and said he would deliver the food to me!!! Best African food in the DMV.
I miss my family so much I wish I can switch a flick and they come back 😌
The place is closed due to a fire. Hopefully, it will reopen!

Called looking for Sierra Leonian food.  Found the right place.  However, the restaurant is presently closed due to a fire.  Sumah offered to prepare the food from home and bring it to our hotel.  We were thrilled!  Delicious food, specially prepared, made for a very nice evening.  The potato leaf and the cassava leaf were just as I remember it.  High praise for Sumah.  Thank you again!
The best ever been here since I was 16 years old
Don't eat it
Very good Sierra Leonian food.
Good food great service
Very nice place for local african dishes .
Unfortunately, this amazing restaurant had a fire and is closed as of 12.31.18
I love the service and the food. Customer for over 12 yrs
Rat infested place
Tried Sierra Leone egusi soup. Very different than the Nigerian or Cameroonian version.
I love this place, best west African food in DC. They are close from a fire now unfortunately

Owner was very welcoming and kind. It was my first time trying Senegalese food and the owner provided samples of all food options and allowed me to try the food first. Everything I ordered was super favorable! I def recommend.
Assalamu alaikum I like the casava leaf!! The service is always great here!! Great for groups, also!! A fire? We're waiting for our GRAND OPENING SOON!
Great food and good service. Unfortunately it's currently closed because of the fire.
Excellent food & drinks in a comfortable friendly atmosphere with a great staff. The jollof rice and goat was excellent!

I went there for the second time.  The food was really good.  The service was better than the first time I went.  The food was still good as the first time.  The owner was friendly and came to say hello and several times came to check on us.  The food is fresh so it won’t come out quickly.  This is a takeout place so don’t expect more than good food.  I had the Jollof rice with the red sauce.  I forgot the name.  The plantians were fried well.  I had the ginger beer.  Delish!!! Will return
Sumah serves good West African food. Great hospitality!
Great owners
The people there are rude and impolite
You have to try this place! The food is amazing, we drive over an hour every few weeks to come here. They let you sample the different types of sauces if it's your first time visiting.
The food was so good it made me want to cry! It's hard to find good Sierra Leonean food and this was the bomb!
If I could give a 0 I would. Terrible customer service. This is why Sierra Leonean businesses fail! Don’t waste your time!

The owner is very welcoming.  And they will give you a sample of all the stew sauces so that you can make an informed decision on what you would like to eat. It made it hard to decide as EVERY stew was amazing!
The food is 🔥🔥🔥. Decorum isn't fancy but the food makes up for it.
Good is always delicious!
Always on point. I always get the spinach and goat meat, with rice.
I really love their delicious dishes but too much money for small dish, it's not fair at all
Love! Kind people and great food
Good west african food.
The owner is super friendly! The food and  sauce it’s really delicious !Must try!
Great sized portions. Cassava stew is delicious. In and out service.will definitely make another trip. My new west African spot.
First introduced to Sumahs over 10 yrs ago. The food is still awesome!!
The best authentic African food in town. Whenever I'm in the area I stop to take home.

First of all, food is really Not that amazing. It's decent but definitely had much better west African food in the area, such as Chez Dior. Portions is rather small and meat was chewy. Secondly, i agree with many other reviews that there's pretty much no service. All the chairs and tables are pretty used and dirty. Third, wth is going with all these plastic plates and containers when you are dinning in?! It is horrible for the environment and doesn't give any feeling of a real restaurant.
Prices slightly increased but good food!!!
West African (Sierra Leone) Food is Bomb

Great variety of delicious West African dishes freshly prepared with traditional ingredients and spices!  A must for anyone who wishes to tantalize their taste buds with the flavors of Africa, and enjoy a hearty good meal!  Sumah is a lovely and joyful man - he will make you feel at home!  My husband and I are visiting DC this weekend, and ate at Sumah's West African Restaurant, yesterday (Friday) having been recommended by one of the front desk staff at the hotel we are staying at. This front desk staff happened to be caucasian - needless to say I was pleased to learn that she enjoys West African cuisine.  Upon arrival at Sumah's restaurant Sumah was very friendly, and learning that this was our first time coming he arranged a sampler plate filled with all the dishes from his menu! He made us feel very welcome.  His restaurant was busy full of customers from various cultural backgrounds, and he and his staff were very jovial and welcoming.  We ordered pounded yam with egusi soup, as well as jollof rice with fried plantains, peanut stew and cassava leaves. We had the option of proteins to include, goat meat, chicken or fish. We drank a West African Ginger drink to accompany our meal. It was an amazing taste sensation and a culinary delight!  We will be visiting again on our next trip to DC!

I had previously gone here twice. Once in my own when I first moved here. Slow service but good food. Second time was in a date. Again, slow service good food. I recently attempted to go twice to grab dinner on my way home. I couldn’t even order because there was not anyone to ask and it was very crowded, so I skipped out. Tonight, I went there again, hoping to grab dinner on my way home. I patiently waited by the queue of people at the counter and was told to sit down. I sat down and then was told to move for a couple there when there were other open tables for them to sit, so I left. I give up on trying to give them another chance. Crappy customer service, long wait time, decent West African food, albeit a little oily depending on your preference. But I really didn’t like not being asked, but being told to move with no apology or anything after being told to sit initially.  Not my cup of tea. This last time was the worst.
the food was delicious atmosphere Cosi people are very nice
West African food at its finest!

I asked one of the old lady who works in the restaurants where to buy the cassava leaves, I swear to God this lady didn't want me to know where to buy it because she thinks that if I know where to buy it I will buy it and cook it in my house so they will loose me as a customer, I couldn't believe it.  so greedy  😡

The food is delicious, a real authentic West African cuisine. Jollof Rice, white or brown rice served with different sources made out of Okra reach in Iron called Okra Soup, Sweet Potatoe Leaves and Greens both of which are very rich in Vits A, C & B6, Riboflavin and fiber. They have egusi Soup, Pounded Yam, Foofoo, Goat meat soup but above all I enjoyed the Cassava leaves the most cooked in rich Western African palm Oil.
Best west African food in the city
DELICIOUS!!!! Absolutely Delicious!!! What else am I supposed to say
All I know there source most be 😋 🥗😳

Good food, but terrible customer service. It's great when you're new but go there for a while and you'll get treated like the dirt under their foot. They don't greet longtime customers, don't inform you of your position in line, act surly when there's a concern being brought up, and etc... Warning!!! If you order your food over the phone they won't prepare it. I've dealt patiently w/ their poor customer service for years. Good food... Horrible customer service.  To be fair and objective about this whole thing... I've sat back and watched this place treat it's primarily professional class Black patron like trash for almost 12 years. This restaraunt has only survived due to an influx newcomers who eat there leave a great review about their food but never have to deal w/ them again. LONG TIME RESIDENTS AND NATIVES of this area know to beware of this business. The wife is the surliest of the whole bunch and the owner is almost as bad. I've been perfectly honest when saying that this restaraunt has the worst customer service I've ever experienced.

Delicious, authentic food from friendly, polite staff. Very large portions. If you are new to West African cuisine, they will give you a sample plate so you can pick what you want. Seating is limited so we recommend carrying out if dining in groups larger than 3.
Good food
Nice friendly, I will prefer others there, I will be coming back.
They're very rude and inconsiderate
My first time eating there and it was great. Black owned and staff was very friendly.  Will be going back soon.
Generous portions and hilarious owner
Yummy, heavy food though.
Best African food in DC.
Extremely delicious, with helpful staff. If you've never been before, they'll let you try all the entrees to help you decide what you want. BYOB, which is nice.
The owner was such a nice guy. If it is your fist time there you get samples of all the stews so you can choose which one of them you'll like. It was so delicious I will definitely go back there!
Terrible Terrible customer service.
Expensive !!
First time there & the experience was great! The guy brought us a plate to sample popular items. I ended up getting the Potato Leaves which was great! I will definitely be returning

Took a group of kids here to experience West African Cuisine, the restaurant easily accommodated us and created a great experience for the kids to try a variety of foods. The owner was very personable and authentic!  They’ve got tons of great sauces and spices from all over West Africa, probably some of the best variety I’ve seen States side.
Very nice people! Loved the food!! They gave us a sample because it was our first time and made us fresh ginger beer. Definitely worth a visit if you don’t mind waiting a little :)
In love with everything they serve

Her husband is a creep! Very rude to women! He tried to slip me his phone number and when I told his wife, he told me not to come back to the store. His wife was not there when he told me that. He was upset with me because my aunt said the place was too dirty for her to eat at. Beware of the husband. He is phony as hell.
Customer service absolutely terrible.

Best African restaurant ever! I'm from Houston, I'm just visiting DC for a couple days and I had to tried it. I had heard so many things about this place and I was so excited to try it. Don't listen the haters guys. This place deserves 10 🌟. Great costumers services. I had a great experience. Ms Sumah looks like my mom btw lol. Anyway, I enjoyed  and believe me you will as well.
Came in for the first time with a friend and they gave me a sampling of the sauces and some rice, then some watermelon. All of it tasted amazing. I'm bringing my family
The food is authentic and absolutely amazing, but be prepared to wait. They are often busy. The staff is very nice and welcoming. I love this place.
The owner was so nice. We were greeted as soon as we came in. The food is delicious and abundant. You must try the ginger juice.

Omg They Have The Best African Food In The DMV I Have tasted their customer skills are wonderful the dude is so nice and caring if you want some good African food that tastes like back home you should go here ..  don't listen to anybody I think you should go there for yourself before you judge the book by the cover
The food is great there .
Great
A wonderful place to visit.you will be glad you did.
The best African food i had in awhile. Way better than what we have in Houston. When ever u are in Washington DC and what some good African food pls check them out...
Delicious food with huge portions. Super friendly staff who were incredibly helpful finding what to eat there. The in house ginger beer has a bold flavor.
The food was great and the atmosphere felt like been in grandma's kitchen/home. It was awesome!! I will definitely visit when im back in DC..
Food and Customer services

They ask if you've ever dined with them. If you haven't they tell you to have a seat & bring you a sample of all their main dishes.  I bought a few sides and was full after not even putting a dent in half. Yummy!
Great authentic West African cuisine.
Best Sierra leone food in town, hands down!
Wonderful food excellent service they were a little slow but the good food n kind service made up for it

I used to love this place but the customer service is terrible.  The owner doesn't have any customer service skills, i asked him a question and not only did he not answer but when i asked again he was like i heard you! Well let's reply to answers then.  I really wanted to support my black businesses but the horrible attitude you get for services u paid  isnt worth it!
The food is great try it out for your self before listening to some one else I love this place they are so nice to Me when I come !!!

Just Wow!  We came here just before close and ordered our food to go. It was awesome. We devoured it when we went back to the hotel. Still had leftovers yo take home with us and enjoyed every morsel of it.
Friendly service and the food is always great
Good food and hospitable people!

Delicious!!! I had the peanut butter stew and the Egusi stew.....it's utterly delicious. The Madam at the restaurant brought a test plate to start so you can try the various dishes and sauces. I loved it. Felt so comfortable and relaxed here. I'll definitely be back!
Best West African food in the entire D.C. area period 👍
This is a wonderful eatery with the best home cooking. I felt like I was home, and the service was amazing. I literally kicked my feet together under the table with joy.
Great customer service and food. Makes you feel like home.
It was great to sample food before ordering, and they were so sweet.
I used to love this place but now their food is very salty.
I really enjoy the food I buy from here .
Of all the West African places I ate at in the DC/Maryland area, this place had the tastiest food of all of them. I really recommend it.
Good Food. More Sirrra Leone and Ghana but tasty
Love their food!!
Excellent food and great host!
First time here, the food was great and the service even better. Felt very comfortable and I left very full. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Hello Mr and Mrs Sumah, Please expand your great food to Reno Nevada. The Nevada area should have the Sumah's experience. I need some cassava leaf  with fish in my life YEEESS!!!!!!!!! WE NEED YOUR FOOD HERE. I cant wait to see you guys again its been a while.
Really good. Worth a try if you've never had West African good before
The food is really good and they serve a generous portion.
Great service, great food, wonderful people who always welcome me! Try the ginger beer!

This was my best friend & I first time here & we enjoyed our experience! I had the "Krain Krain" stew with "Jollof Rice". The food tasted fantastic & was a great serving size. As soon, as we walked in we were greeted with smiles & because this was our first time here we were offered samples of every single dish; which I thought was very generous. The price ranges are not too bad ($14-$17), compared to other African Restaurant establishments. I will definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to have good & reasonably priced authentic West African food with good vibes!

This restaurant is an awesome restaurant. The food was quite delightful. Being that we were new the owner allowed us to sample each item off the menu which was really helpful. I ended up picking the cassava Leaf soup which was really good. I would recommend this restaurant to anybody who want authentic African food!
The food is awesome

If I could give then zero stars I would! Called them at 12:30pm for some pepper soup. Was told it wasn't ready for 1 hour. Called back after 2pm to get updated, was told it is ready to go. Was really excited being that I drove all the way from Germantown, MD which took me 50 minutes to get there. Arrived there at 2:30 and was told I had to wait another 15 minutes which meant another 30 min. I was pissed. I have to be at work at 4pm! Why wasn't I told this on the phone. Instead of an apology I was told I was wrong for being upset. These are some really rude people with a poor idea of what customer service means. Left with no apology and no food. I have been going for 10 + years and I will not return again!!!!!

I read the reviews so I was prepared and able to exercise patience in order to enjoy my visit. It took a long time for us to be seated (like 10 min of being ignored) and way longer for the waitress to come over to get our order. She brought a sample plate since my friend never had west African food before. I loved getting to taste everything so that I could see which dishes they really do well. We ended up ordering pepper soup (with cow foot), egusi, and palava sauce. All of it was AMAZING!! I also tried the ginger juice since I wasn’t aware it was BYOB and neglected to bring a bottle. The owner was very nice and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The food was much better than it was at Appioo. I’ll definitely be back!
Delish.... I love it!

I only wrote a review because I saw a few bad ones. Sumah is a sweet man, but this is not a high end restaurant so some of the expectations people have are really unreasonable. You go to Sumah’s for really good authentic African food. It’s pricey, but worth it and he’s a wonderful business owner. It is family run, not a chain. The cultural divide unfortunately has a lot of entitled Americans feeling as though maybe they should be treated like royalty for being a patron,  but often times they don’t want to give respect to receive it. I can say that as a regular customer, I have never been disappointed by the food and that any negative experience related to treatment is probably promoted by a pompous and arrogant individual who was first disrespectful. All that said, great food and even better ginger beer!
Outstanding food
Always go here when I am missing home cooked meals
African restaurant with various meal. The food is great, tasty, and appealing.The only burden for me is that the food is a little too oily. Let's cut the fat out...
Yummmmmm!!!! Never disappoints - hits the spot!
Yayyy. 40 mins walk to this place didn't go to waste. Their service is wonderful Nigerian brethren, they have our swallows. This place is for any West African who misses home cooked meal.
Their food tastes good, but it has too much of oil in my opinion.
The food was so delicious I forgot to take a pic. It was a welcoming place to sit & enjoy my yummy meal.
Great food!!!!! The owner treats you like family.
Friendly staff. Samples for those of us new to West African food. Delicious and generous portions.

Ive been eating here for almost 20 years now from Time to time and it's some of the most authentic African cuisine you can find in the DMV. Just too many bones sometimes which i find is common in these African and west Indies type restaurants but the small fragments can be dangerous and I hope the address this.l.
This place is amazing I grew up here
Really good food authentic to Sierra Leone!  Very generous portions! Friendly and fun staff!
The food is awesome and they always make me feel at home every time I come.....
The BEST west Afrikan food in the Washington Dc area hands up . Big Ups Sumah's
Customer service was great and the food was delicious
Excellent  Nice African food, just eat with caution if fish is included due to fish bones!
Best West African Food ever whole family loves it
Great place. Very traditional

Good experience.  I really enjoyed the food. I didn't like the facts that they don't serve you water to drink except you buy bottled water. They should change that. The young server was a little aggressive too
Good food
Good food.
Love the food. They give you a 1 bite sample plate so you know exactly what you want! They are nice people with great customer service.
Food is awesome i must say the best i ever had in town 100. You must try it you will want it everyday. I.J.S. TRUST ME. MMM GOODIE DON'T MISS OUT

Casual, friendly, no frills West African. Full disclosure, not sure I've ever had West African food, but I was surprised how much I liked it. Our first time there they sat us down and fed us a free sampler plate just so we'd know what we were ordering. Large portions (large size easily fed two adults). Smaller menu, but there's a real difference between each of the menu items. Everything is served with your choice of goat, chicken, fish, or beef. I'd go back.
Great food, best place I've got African food from in DC so far

Soooooooo good!  BOTH the food AND the service! It was my first time having West African food. I ordered the Engunsi with chicken & foo foo..YUM!  The best parts tho?...... ------------------------- 1) They brought out a sample plate of all the food so I could choose.  2) They brought out watermelon for dessert.  So perfect on a hot summer day!  The staff/owners made us feel so at home! 💖 The food was flavorful and a great portion. Will def be back!!
Delicious food and incredible service!!!
Great food!
Food taste great
One of my favorite places in D.C. I love the family that owns it, they're always extremely kind and caring. I always leave here in a good mood.  10/10 stars

Amazing authentic food in a humble setting. The owner takes customer service to the extreme!   When we went to leave it started raining and he insisted that we borrow his umbrella!  Portions are large and delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant!
The food was amazing and the servers were very friendly. It was raining and he even offered us his umbrella!
I love this place. I grew up in the neighborhood  and have been going for years. Now I drive from Arlington just to get my fix!!

THE WORST RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD! .... I have been a loyal customer to Sumah's for over 6 years-- since I have been a resident of DC. I've brought my mother (who visited from CA), my professors, countless amount of friends, and supervisors to this establishment. Unfortunately, today will be the last day that I support Sumah and his raggedy restaurant.  Earlier today I ordered a plate of food (joloff rice with 3 stews) and made sure to specify that I did not want "BEEF" and only wanted chicken as my meat selection. Unfortunately, when I arrived home, I noticed my meal did not include the chicken that I asked for.  I immediately called Sumah and tried to explain the situation. Instead of his wife admitting that she misunderstood my "no beef" request, Sumah's wife decided to argue with me over the phone. She finally hands the phone to Sumah and he immediately tells me to bring the plate back.  When I arrive-- instead of a pleasant " sorry for the inconvenience" or "sorry for the misunderstanding" Sumah and his wife approaches the counter with a DISGUSTING attitude. Sumah then begins to patronize me by saying that if I want chicken I should give him an additional $2. I tried to explain to Sumah that I left my home without my wallet because I thought it would be a quick transaction. Sumah then tells me to go back home and bring him $2!!!!! Excuse me??? I just spent $18 on a plate of food from your establishment, not to mention the $35 my friend and I spent literally the week before (literally 6 days ago)-- and you're worried about 2 freaking dollars!!?!?!!? I politely ask the wife for my money back and she proceeds to tell me "no" after she lies about me seeing that there was no chicken initially placed in my plate.  Not wanting to cause a scene in front of their non-Black/African customers (who they clearly value more than the customers who look like them [information gathered from several of their previous reviews]) I tell the wife that I will be posting a Yelp review about the establishment and I proceed to leave. As I am walking down the street, Sumah chases me to my car and tells me "IF YOU LEAVE THE YELP REVIEW DO NOT COME BACK. IN FACT, WHEN YOU'RE DONE CALL CNN!"  After over 6 years of being a loyal customer, supporting a Black owned business directly and indirectly, you would think the owner would be understanding and more accommodating. Sumah and his wife are UNPROFESSIONAL, DISGUSTING, DISLOYAL business owners. They care nothing about the community that supports them and are only concerned about money. **Please give your money to business owners that value you as much as they value your money.**
Good African Food...
The cassava leaves and the okra are amazing! If you go here they're so friendly and generous you will most definitely be going back!
The Ginger Root was soooo good!!!

I had my worse experience ever in a restaurant. I have travelled to about 30 countries across the globe I have never met such an arrogant restaurant owner/tenant. I did not intend to do a review but he literally told me " I am in business for more than 20 years, I won't serve you, go and write whatever you want, I don't care". All this incident erupts as a results of trying to tell him gently he could not take my order 2-3 meters from where I was sitting with very unprofessional manners. His reaction was completely disproportionate and uncalled for. When people start making few bucks, they forget the essence of business: service to fellow humans! He asked me if I knew who he was and I responded by asking him if he was Donald Trump! How sad!
Food is amazing!!! But the wait is longgggg don't call in that doesn't work you'll still have to wait but it's sooooo good!!!!

Been coming here over 20 years with my mother and the family has always remembered me and my family. Now I bring my children and all of my friends. Some people are skeptical to tasting food from cultures they have never experienced but once they taste Sumahs they are hooked. Love this place and the people that run it.
Ive been coming here for my West-African food fix for over 15 years now! I LOVE the food and Sumah💋.
Food is very good ,A little overpriced customer service is good when the employees are in a great mood most of the time the employees have an attitude and give you bad customer service

An excellent restaurant with a great owner and great food. The atmosphere could be a bit better, but the service and quality of the food more than makes up for that. My favorite dishes are potato leaf, okra stew, and spinach with fish. This is a must-visit restaurant!

I love it....I love it, My favorite African Restaurants...It is worth a trip to go here Thank you for bringing Africa food to Washington DC...May God continue to bless this place the food is so amazing ♡♡♡♡
This was the first restaurant that I ate at in DC 14 years ago.  The food is so good, I still eat here to this day. A little pricey, but worth it!

I went there with a friend because we thought it was cheap. In fact it was the complete opposite. We paied 20$ each (what isn't that much) but it wasn't worth it. The meal didn't taste that bad but there were broken chicken bones in the food and partly little splitter of bones. It's absolutely not made for families with children. We ate from plastic bowls which normally are made for takeaway food. We had plastic cutlery and plastic Cups. At least I cant say anything against the owner of the "restaurant"( which doesn't really look like one neither from outdoor nor from indoor) because they had been friendly. But 20$ for that food?! Honestly that is too much!
Amazing service authentic west african food!!!!!
Only issue is they are slow but besides that food is deliciously good

One Sunday, I ordered Jollof rice to go, and it took literally an hour to bring me my food. Disappointingly, the rice was not flavorful and spicy enough (It also tasted reheated-not fresh). Plus, they are too expensive. They charged me over $16.00 for a medium portion of rice with stew. Way over price in my opinion. I prefer Zion Kitchen and Kitchen Near You's service and food quality much better, and they are cheaper.
Friendly staff and super good food 10/10
Food is great. Brings tears of joy. Praise to God For Isata cook and owner. She is like big mama all are welcome.  I'll be back.
Great authentic African food
Warm and welcoming staff, local family restaurant with good food. If it's your first time there, you'll get a plate to taste test all the dishes on the menu before choosing what you'd like to eat.
Great African food.
I was there twice because I miss it
Great choice of African restaurant for the area!
Great authentic West African food. Place is a little dingy and service can be slow.
I don't know what's better actually, the service or the food, as both are top notch. The food is authentically and delicious. Sorry y'all, but if I have my way, he'll be moving to Philly!
Good Food but call to double check on what they are accepting at that time speaking on the payment option
I absolutely LOVE this place the food is amazingly good❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤
Great food, very tasty! However the cost is kinda expensive. Plus the large containers should be visually bigger than the medium. So you can see what your paying for.

They prepare very good, palatable food. I always buy food there. They sell different sauces/soups like potato leaves, cassava leaves, krain krain, okra, tolla, peanut butter soup, pepper soup, spinach, stew and others like jolof rice, ginger beer, fried fish, fried plantains and a whole lot more. Visit them today and see the difference. You will definitely come back for more.
Good people, good food, food tastes just like you were in Sierra Leone
Their food is so addictive

Went there with some friends and was shown genuine hospitality. We were able to sample the different sauces and receives 5 star experience. Will definitely go again because the food is also delicious!!
Took too long to get service. No parking around the restaurant. The price is high.
I felt absolutely at home here. The hospitality was second to none. And the food, especially the cassava leaf stew was a blast. It a place i will always come back to whenever in the washington area.
Fantastic food, I give you a 5. The service was wonderful, good job guys.

Sevice is slow. it is no frills as far as atmosphere but I give the food 5 stars. since it was my first time, the server gave me a sample. I ordered the joloff rice tomato sauce fish with casava leaves and potatoes leaves unbelievable. sublime.

I ordered the spinach dish with chicken and a ginger beer. Everything was absolutely delicious. The meat had an amazing sauce and the spinach was fantastic. The ginger beer is homemade and blew me away. It tastes like lemonade at first and then tastes like ginger at the end. It is a comfortable, casual place to sit down. I has a friendly conversation with some other guests. It is worth noting that it is cash only and a meal ranges from about $14 to about $17.
Food is the best always. Been going for years best customer service.
Food is the BEST!  CLEAN, COOKED JUST RIGHT, FLAVOR, & GOOD PEOPLE
username: Tinya Clayton Sesay, MHA, BSM, HRM

caption: I love it...The best food ever 👌😄😄😄
A neighborhood institution. The best African restaurant in DC hands down. Ask for free samples if in doubt.
I bought the Pounded Yam and Okra soup to go! I am satisfied with my meal!
I love the food, and even moreso the gracious hospitality of Mr. Sumah! My go-to spot for authentic Sierra Leonean food in DC! I happily commute all the way from Maryland just to satisfy my craving!
Wonderful authentic delicious food,  great service, and positive energy!  My husband and I stopped in and loved it. Flavor is what you will get!!! Thanks Sumah!
Really good west African food. Loved most of the sauces so we ended up getting a platter of everything.

Honestly the food is great! But the service was terrible! I waited an hour and a half for my food to get ready. The first forty five mintues, I was brushed off and told to wait. I was told he was too busy! Honestly, The owner waa entaining a group of white customers and gave then five star service and brushed everyone else off and treated everyone ekse rudely. I was trying to ask questions about the food and figure out my order. I honestly was very put off. I may go back because the food is great but honestly I'm not sure.

I have been craving cassava for some months now asking anyone I knew from West Africa to make me some even offered to buy all the ingredients needed for this wonderful dish. Finally my pray was answered when a coworker saw the desperation and suggested Sumah's restaurant. All I can say is all I needed was a taste and I fell in love😍 Mr Sumah was very hospitable having me sample many flavors until I got the taste I wanted the most🙌🏾,thank you! I will be back and will definitely spread the word.

I've not had better West African food in the United States than I had at Sumah's.  To be clear, the place is not much to look at, and many people may be turned off by the location and facilities. However, West African food is a truly unique cuisine that is a rare gem to come by, and Sumah is a fine example.  I spent years living in West Africa and came to love the flavor and spice of their food. It is almost impossible to find good food from this region in the US. DC has several options, but I believe Sumah's to be the best.  This particular style comes from Guinea/ Sierra Leone and makes heavy use of palm oil in their dishes. I love the peanut sauce and the leaf sauce here!  The owner and his family have lived in the States for many years now but come from this region. In fact, I've been to his home village, and the food here smacks of authenticity.  Nowadays, it seems like you can get food from anywhere in the US, but if you're looking for a one-of-a-kind culinary experience, give this place a try.
This restaurant is great. I came from out of town and didn't know what to eat. So I stopped here and I am so glad I did.
I love sumah the food is very good I've been going for years
I love the cassava leave soup, it always remind me when I lived in Sierra Leone
This a nasty  place nasty rats running under tables. .. bad bad service non atención to the guest no recomendable. ........sucks
Best restaurant don't let the outside appearance fool you,the workers are  soo nice..

I grew up in West Africa, and this restaurant took me home. If you want authentic food, this is the place to go. The atmosphere and service is authentic, too. That means plastic forks, paper napkins, and takeaway containers. For me, that was heaven. Other people might not agree. I loved that Sumah was there running the place, and he was very courteous and friendly.
Step into West Africa here. A bit slow but with the wait. When I'm reminiscing about West Africa and craving peanut butter sauce, I come here.

Very boring restaurant with an owner who has a bad attitude. We wanted to eat with a fork but they were only able to find 2 forks. The option was to eat with plastic fork. The owner was not courteous and dismissed our complaint about lack of silverwares. I definitely will not go back and I will not recommend the restaurant. Just go to Zion if you want to enjoy african food. We came to summer because zion ws closed on Sunday evening.
Fantastic West African food.
Excellent customer service.  Beautiful ambiance and delicious food. I will definitely come back here to get some authentic West African Food!
Awesome food, customer service, I luve it. I have been a customer for 19 years.
Been eating at Sumahs close to 10 years now.  The absolute best ethnic restaurant in the city.
Great place. Great Liberian Food. Strongly recommended...

This is a very modest restaurant, in which the owners will make you feel at home. This is the best West Africa food in DC, but you will have to be ready to eat it in paper plates: worthwhile, and inexpensive too!
I love Sumah!! Food is awsome!!! Sometimes the service can be slow if it's crowded but worth the wait. I drive from upper marlboro just to have my fix. 💛💚❤

Love the food! They bring you a smapling plate when you come in, very clever. Most non-Africand would appreciate the opportunity to sample an unknown food before they buy a whole order. The owner was very friendly. Don't let the appearance fool you; great hole in the wall place.
The service is horrible!!! Don't go here!! . The lady at the front desk has an attitude and the man is very aggressive and rude!!!  I wouldn't recommend this place to my worse enemy.
Love love love ALL there dishess!
Extremely disappointed. The jollof and stew had no flavor, the lady at the counter had an attitude, and it wasn't a welcoming environment at all. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

The food is nasty! Such a waste of money and my time!  I lost my appetite after two bites into the food! They don't have half the things they claim on the menu! Customer service is terrible! I would never recommend this place to anyone. The place look dirty! I don't even know how they received a 4 star rating!
Rice was stale.
The food is delicious!!! I traveled from St. Charles to find some good food and stumbled upon Sumah's. I Loved it. Will be going back for more and more.

Delicious, wonderful restaurant. The owner was wonderful, and he allowed my family & I to taste the menu items before ordering (since we have never had african food before), and everything was delicious. We had a great time and I will be coming again.
best ever
Wonderful customer service, we got a sample of each sauce and got to pick two with fish, chicken or beef, delicious!

I have been going to Sumah's for over 5 years now and I have been hooked every since. I remember a time that I went there 3x in one week. My favorite dish would be the Cassava and Chicken over rice...MMMMMMM Good! I love the atmosphere and the conversations that I receive from the owners whenever I am in the restaurant, they truly make you feel like family. I would recommed anyone looking for good authentic West African Food to go to Sumah's
Absolutely delicious, affordable, and very hospitable! I felt like part of the neighborhood and not just a customer.
While the facade doesn't look like much, the food was amazing and the service was outstanding! We tried the cassava and potato leaf sauces over beef.

Delicious, authentic West African cuisine. The cassava leaf sauce was one of the best I've ever had on either side of the Atlantic! Staff were friendly and will even give you a taste of each sauce before you order if it's your first time there. I recommend highly!

YUM! YUM! We went to the Smithsonian and thought of having a great meal in D.C., and we found the best West African restaurant, Sumah's. The chef gave us a sample of all the sauces to select from, and they were all GREAT! I luv the okra and peanut butter sauce, my older daughter and her fiancee luvs the Cassava Leaves and tomato sauce, and spinach sauce is yummy too. The meat was cooked well and the pounded yam is yummy too. The service is friendly, Very authentic food. We will have to go again some day!!!
The food was really good. rice with cassava leaves was off the chain. The owner is very friendly. Sumah, you will need a bigger place. I will definitely go back next time I'm in  DC.

The menu is simple: sauces, which are paired with meat, chicken, or fish, all served on a bed of rice. We weren't sure what we wanted, so our friendly server (also the owner?) brought us a sample of each to try. All of them were good, but we got the potato leaves and cassava. We ordered large (rather than medium) portions, and even though we were hungry the leftovers provided us both with lunch the next day. One caveat: the food is very rich. We'll go back, certainly, but we need a while to recover first!
Great Place!!! Loved it

I went this Saturday because i really wanted some casava leaf and the owner she was so helpful and sweet and gave me a gracious sample. I came all the way from anacostia on the train bc i really wanted it and i was beyond satisfied. Great place to go

Since coming to United States from Togo I have been looking for an authentic West African restaurant. I was recently introduced to Sumah's by a good friend. The atmosphere, service and food are absolutely amazing! My favorite dish is the pounded yam with okra soup. Best West African restaurant in town!

You will not be disappointed! We were a group in town for a conference and seeking African cuisine for dinner. Never having had Sierra Leonean before, we decided to give it a try. The front windows and door had that cloudy appearance, like when water gets between the panes, and there was no indication that they were open or even in business, but I poked my head in and saw they were actually open. Please don't be put off by the "minimalist" decor. Mr Sumah was incredibly hospitable and gracious. He offered us samples of the sauces and was very accommodating of our various dietary requirements. Our family-style meal was unbelievably delicious! For about $20 per person - including homemade ginger beer, fried plantains, and tax & tip - we left full and carrying leftovers for another meal. Mr Sumah even hailed us a taxi back to our hotel. Will definitely visit again the next time I'm in DC!

Absolutely THE BEST SIERRA LEONE FOOD IN TOWN! EVERYTHING IS DELICIOUS & the customer service you receive from when you walk in the door until you leave is so hospitable! Unsure on what to order the owner lets you sample a little of EVERYTHING and was very patient w/me (being as though I'm a very picky eater lol).....I live in VA and would take the 40min drive any day to get some of the cassava leaves w/chicken and the okra!!!!!!!!
Excellent well prepared meal with African taste. He has been in business more 20 years
If you want real West African Food that taste great...my friend this is the #1 Best Place.  My family has been eating her for over 20 years.

Sumah, the owner is a very nice man, but he really takes his time getting the food out to you. However, the food is amazing and extremely filling.I like the beef with tomato sauce and jaloff rice. You won't be disappointed.

Good food at an hour of the day. I went once in the afternoon, another time in the evening and left with fresh tasty food both times. They are generous and kind. They will gladly offer you a sample of each sauce to decide which one you want. Prices start at $14 up to $17 depending on which size dish you choose. You get what you pay for. The wait is not long for take out and there is a tv that plays the news. Will definitely be going back soon.
Great place!

I've been there twice and I love it! Sumah is very nice and welcoming. The first time I went, he brought me a sampler plate, so I could try each sauce and decide which to order. The second time, I brought my fiance and he gave us the sampler again so he could try each sauce for himself. My favorite is the jollof rice, but all of the sauces are great. They also sell ginger beer, which is delicious and very strong. It is a friendly, cozy place with news or African music videos playing on the TV. We were served our food in a takeout container and we ate with plastic forks. I would definitely recommend this place to someone who wants a good, casual meal in DC!

This is the first West African restaurant I have been to in the US.  Now, to be honest it is a hole in the wall local type of place that doesn't look that impressive, but for me I prefer to walk into a place and see that everyone else there is obviously West African.  That usually means the food is good!  After spending time in Benin, Ghana, and Liberia, this definitely brought back memories.  The lady was kind enough to make a sampler plate for us to try the different sauces.  They were all amazing and it took us awhile to decide which ones to try.  We were able to pick a choice of two sauces which was nice!  There was enough food for multiple meals of leftovers.  The ginger beer was also delicious!  The various people in our party who were from West Africa were impressed as well as those who had never eaten West African food. One thing I will caution though is that they do not truly have vegetarian food.  My friend who is vegetarian ordered her dishes without meat, but realized later that there were small bits of meat in the sauce.  They probably cook the meat in the sauce and just dipped around it.
Fufu and peanut butter soup. Oooh!
The food was great. I always went back.
Delicious!!!!! The Spinach and Fish is the greatest dish in the world....

A friend showed this to me the other day. As the other reviewers  have said, the food is absolutely incredible. I tried everything (they can give you a sample platter) and took about 10 minutes to decide. Everything is rich and flavorful. The cassava and the peanut butter sauce seem to be peoples' favorites, but I went for the tomato stew - it's a bit milder, and the flavor is full, yet subtly. Definitely recommended. The plantains are a treat too, very tasty and a huge portion - value for money!  When the food arrives, it's plentiful - I've gotten two meals out of it and still have leftovers!  The atmosphere is also amazing, true hospitality and an incredibly relaxed vibe. Definitely a highlight!

My experience was excellent. I went to this carryout spot b/c the restaurant I was looking for was closed.  The owner was very friendly and let me sample the foods before I ordered. The peanut butter soup was delicious, though I came to get chicken or fish with tomato stew.  The food tasted very fresh and was seasoned well.  I will definitely come again.
Tomato and peanut butter sauce dishes are fantastic.  Service is slow, but extremely friendly.  Diner is shabby but clean enough; service is styrofoam and plastic.  No alcohol.
The food at Sumah's was very good and quiet authentic. After living in West Africa for two years, this restaurant brought me right back.
